Properly handling in-place might not be as easy as it seems. Sometimes you actually need to move the Variable in the graph. Consider this case:

x = Variable(torch.zeros(10, 10))
y = Variable(torch.randn(10), requires_grad=True)
x[2] = y
x.sum().backward()
assert y.grad.data.eq(torch.ones(10))

body:
Properly handling in-place might not be as easy as it seems. Sometimes you actually need to move the Variable in the graph. Consider this case:
```python
x = Variable(torch.zeros(10, 10))
y = Variable(torch.randn(10), requires_grad=True)
x[2] = y
x.sum().backward()
assert y.grad.data.eq(torch.ones(10))
```
